Posts.EditableText:
Can Quest build multi-user dungeons for use on the internet? From what I have seen it looks like a single player MUD and was woundering if it could accomidate large numbers of players.

Also I would to know if their is room for custom codeing, for the creation of complex combat systems and character creation.

If anyone knows of any good tutorials on this software then please let me know as soon as possible.
Posts.HTML:
Can Quest build multi-user dungeons for use on the internet? From what I have seen it looks like a single player MUD and was woundering if it could accomidate large numbers of players.

Also I would to know if their is room for custom codeing, for the creation of complex combat systems and character creation.

If anyone knows of any good tutorials on this software then please let me know as soon as possible.

Posts.EditableText:
Yes, there is QuestNet, which can be used for MUD's.
And again - yes, it can be used to create VERY customised battle systems.

There is one drawback though - there aren't any tutorials (well, perhaps one or two).
Posts.HTML:

Posts.EditableText:
There is QuestNet Lite - 3 Players - Included with latest free Quest version
Quest Net Home Edition - 30 - Included with latest Quest PRO version
Quest Net Pro - 1000.  I think this is a seperate Quest Net version that you have to order seperately.

I actually have Quest Net Home edition (or HAD).  But i'm learning Visual Basic at the moment, and i'm a full time film maker, and part time musician so i don't really have time for much else.
